Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but the POOL!”
Reviews.Author: filethepiles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 26 -29 2012. The hotel is clean and in good shape. But the pool was filthy the entire time. It was extremely cloudy and had many water bugs. You could not see the bottom of the pool and I would say it was full of bacteria. One of the owners of a unit, (this is a condo hotel) told me that it has had a continuous problem with keeping the pool clean and clear this summer. The pool had no water pressure coming from the jets from the pool pump and they did not give it professional regular maintenance during my stay. If you love a beach front pool at your resort check the pool before checking in! Also the hot tub was broken, it was hot but had no jets working.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprised, I'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: reviewer2186
Reviews.Content: My dad and I went to Daytona Beach for the 2012 Bike Week festivities during Spring Break, and I honestly did not have high expectations. To my surprise, this hotel was really nice! I loved the location & the price tag. It's great access to the Beach, Main St is in walking distance, and it's easy to hop on International Speedway Boulevard to go to the races. We were impressed with how clean the place was, the maid service was exceptional in stocking clean towels and everything. Parking was okay, there was only one night-close to midnight-where we took the last car space. There's easy access to the beach and there's a tiki bar out back. The pool out back is for residents only, so it was never full. It was super clean too. The tiki bar had a DJ too, which was great entertainment. The rooms are not sound proof, but I don't mind hearing a few motorcycles going down A1. I'd stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Fun”
Reviews.Author: 2ENVYus
Reviews.Content: Overall, this place was a great value with a few good reason to return! This hotel does it's very best to be current & fun. We booked our rooms directly with the hotel. Check-in was quick & easy. The only downfall are the dated rooms. We stayed here with another couple, each having an ocean view king room - one room was nicely appointed, the other, not so much - the bed didn't have a headboard. Both rooms did have basic kitchen items. I believe that since these rooms are individually owned, there should be standards that are maintained for all rooms. Housekeeping left a little to be desired. The best parts of this hotel are the Oasis Tiki Bar with a restaurant, a DJ that starts at 1 p.m. and the oceanfront location! These are the reasons are why we will stay here again. It's also walking distance to many bars & restaurants. I would not recommend this place for families with small children. Overall, we liked this place and what it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: Nicelifefor
Reviews.Content: First time in this hotel and kind a like it just make sure when you book in call your reservation is good,front desk is helpfully mr t really help over all good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Old property needs facelift!”
Reviews.Author: Denver49
Reviews.Content: We were in Daytona the during Bike Week (not as a biker, but a spectator) and wanted a room close to Main Street. We were surprised that Fountain Beach had rooms available. That should have aroused our suspicions. The lobby is deceiving...large, nicely furnished. The small old elevator should have also been a clue, but we REALLY wanted to be in town and on the beach. The room location was okay. Small patio that if you look to the right you could see the beach. But the room itself was dark...no lights above, beside or anywhere near the beds. The plumbing was poor. The vanity sink wouldn't drain. Had a hard time flushing the toilet. No ice machine on my floor so I went down to the lobby to buy water. Pop machine wouldn't take my dollar bill. I was told I needed to use quarters. Got my quarters but no money. THEN I was told, Oh, yeah, it's out of water! The whole place is just rundown and in desperate need of some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Lucyek1
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived for bike week from the UK raring to go, checked in no problem and the blonde girl on the front desk was LOVELY! We stayed in 416 which was fine, king size bed but it was mega noisey turning over at night, the room was dated but clean bathroom was small, TV was bulky but overall great for what we wanted. Only issue we had was the balcony door, it wouldnt lock properley! as the room was not secure we decided we needed saftey deposit box - they are in the rooms but when we went to get key and report door not locking we were told the ones in the rooms dont work but we have a secure facility behind the desk which we could use. We used it for out passports only, we lost the key and they wanted 100 dollars to open the box, it was like a mini filing cabinet! Any how we never paid it and got them back with a few grunts from the management, they reckon no one ever lost a key before? and they had no master! who knows. The guys that i dealt with behind the desk wernt overly friendly, asked for change for quaters one day to use the washing machine was told they had none and he walked off! On the plus side the location of this place is great, 3 blocks from main street, pool stairs lead down to the beach, friendly Tiki bar pool etc. I would go back there if i got it for a good price again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card statement!”
Reviews.Author: Karl O
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel stay back in August, and when we get to the hotel with our reservation in HAND. Fountain Beach Resort tells us there's no reservation. But that they'd take a copy of our reservation and it would be taken care of. We get home 3 days later and guess who charged us TWICE! Yep, Fountain Beach Resort charges us for the room on top of what Hotwire.com charged us in August!! We even asked the lady at the desk this morning if everything was ok and she said yes, but took ANOTHER copy of our reservation sheet to make sure. KNOWING the whole time that they had already charged us. NOW, Howire ot the hotel will not refund us our money! My ADVICE IS TO NEVER USE HOTWIRE.COM or FOUNTAIN BEACH RESORT 313 S. Atlantic Ave Daytona Beach, FL 32118

Reviews.Title: “Just OK........”
Reviews.Author: mtnman6108
Reviews.Content: Your entire experience at this property will depend on your room. Each one is individually owned, and decorated differently. If you are fortunate to get an updated room, then you will enjoy your stay. Ours was somewhere in the middle (Room 605). Kind of looked like it was decorated with GOODWILL finds, but it was clean. We had a 2 room suite, and the view of the ocean is excellent. You must be on the right side to get the best view. Oceanfront, and oceanview, are only 1 room apart, and are the same size unit, so you don't need an oceanfront. There were no backups in the elevators, as in previous reviews, even though we were there for Turkey Run Weekend at Daytona Speedway. The hallsways did not smell either, as previouslyend reported. Did love our new HD widescreen in the living room. TV in bedroom was so low you could not see it over your feet. A/C worked great. Kitchen was well stocked. Had coffee-maker, but no COMPLIMENTARY coffee. Had to go out and buy our own. We were fortunate to get a great rate due to a glitch in their computer system, Buy 1 nt, get 1 free. They quickly fixed that, and it became buy 2 nts, get 1 free, still a decent deal. Kristen at the front desk was great! She managed to be extremely pleasant and helpful, on an event weekend, with her computer system down, manually checking in all guests. Again....great employee...give Kristen a RAISE! The back parking lot lights were out and you practically had to feel your way around at night to get to our car. All in all, it really wasn't that bad. Loved driving on the beach. Get a great unit and you'll have a great time. Also....Seafood down the road at "Boondocks" was out of this world! Nothing fancy, just great seafood on he water. Best fried oysters I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Directly on the beach with it's own Tiki Bar - how could it be bad?”
Reviews.Author: IMWITHBOB
Reviews.Content: This isn't a Hilton or even a hotel really - from what I could see most of the units are privately owned and rented out by either the owners of the property or the individuals themselves so every unit is different. We went to Daytona for the beach and the weather and wanted a room that was clean, quiet and cold with a comfortable bed and a working shower and that's exactly what we got. The A/C was ARTIC - our balcony view was amazing, the staff was helpful and it has a Tiki Bar right next to the pool, jacuzzi and mini golf. AND IT'S DIRECTLY ON THE BEACH!!!!! Great bartenders, great food and ice cold drinks! The room and the lobby were dated but who cares? We didn't go on a beach vacation to sit in either place. If you're looking for a laid back relaxing vacation- book here...... If you're wanting turn down bed service and a conciergego - pony up at least 60% more & go stay at the Hilton - you'll HATE this place.

Reviews.Title: “Budget beach getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sassydixiegirl
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms in this place are privately owned like the one we stayed in...#606...you can tell from the lobby and check in area that they have renovated this place...the lobby is very "old school" charming w a lot of Florida decor...the hallways (at least on the 6th floor) smell like someone has pee. It's a hideous knock you out smell...the elevators work but they are def a little scary and very old and grungy...the room we stayed in was very nicely decorated and had pleasing colors and decor...the night stand in between the beds has a mold issue that I smelled all night and the bathtub has major issues w soft spots and tile rot....overall for the $$ we paid, this room was very nice and the owner of this unit obviously cares about it...only other thing is if you are sensitive to EMF's, then be careful...very odd but everytime i have walked down the hallway to our room I have gotten extremely dizzy(almost disoriented feeling) an no I wasn't drinking...hubby's said he felt it too...very strange I have never had that happen before...give the place a chance! For the $$, like I said it's fine...only other complaint is that the balconies are sideways facing...so you are looking at the parking lot, their little golf course thing and the ocean beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Achterhoekertje
Reviews.Content: Service at front desk was allright. The room however was dirty all over. Everything felt moist and not clean. The pool water was as warm as urine... Lots of noisy, constant loud screaming, teethless people.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to see your room before you check in...”
Reviews.Author: Issy_Sue
Reviews.Content: This wasn’t the worst place I have ever stayed but it certainty wasn’t the best either. I arrived a little before check in and my room wasn’t ready, but they let us use the pool while we waited. The pool, bar and entertainment were very nice. I went back to check on my room again and it was ready.. So I went up to see it. It was HORRIBLE (rm 631)! I understand that each room is decorated differently but this was seriously BAD! It was little more than 2 hard beds with old dirty bedding and a 15" TV from the 90s. The deadbolt on the door was hanging off and wouldn’t lock. I am a single woman staying alone with my 10 year old son. This was not going to work for me. It didn’t feel safe at all! I went back down to the front desk; I explained and asked for a new room. At first they told me that the hotel was completely booked for the night. Then they said there was one room left in the whole hotel. I asked if I could look at it and they let me. This room was MUCH nicer and cleaner (rm 410), so I switched to this room. The other thing I wasn’t happy about was the view. When I booked my room I had the option of City View or Ocean View. I paid the higher price for the ocean view.. After seeing the view from a few different rooms, I couldn’t tell the difference, The way the hotel is situated it looks like the view is pretty much the same regardless of the room you are in. I wish I hadn’t paid for the better view, It wasn’t worth it. Oops! Almost forgot the horrible smell in all of the hallways.. Its a cross between wet dog and burnt food. Thank goodness you cant smell it in your room!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: daboy1
Reviews.Content: stayed here a week by my self and had a blast. never worryed about being by my self felt safe. had a great time there.don"t worry about bad review some poeple just are not happy any where they go.dj at pool was great played great tunes. bar was very nice. beach was great . all ready got room to go bak in september.

Reviews.Title: “room 301”
Reviews.Author: shortytt
Reviews.Content: planning on staying here thinking about room 301 does anyone have a review of this room that has actually stayed in it need help i here about the second floor wht about the third floor

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: amg7177
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and the staff was awesome. We got a great deal and the room was perfect for us. We loved the breakfast that they offered was perfect. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this place”
Reviews.Author: jJason
Reviews.Content: After reading about this place I figured we would give it a shot, I read the review about unit 222 and how nice it was so I requested that unit and it was as nice as the review I read about, the room was clean the beds comfy and new the location is the best the staff friendly and the food great, looking foward to comming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ljsflorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed in unit 222 on the second floor, after reading the bad reviews I was hesitant on staying here, got into the room and to my surprise, 2 brand new Serta queen size beds that are comfortable as you can get, flat screen TV, DVD player new loveseat, the room was clean and comfortale the restaurant had good food the DJ played music while we swam in the pool all in all an excellant experince, will be comming back again. They are getting a fitness center with a suaner in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Water, Water, Everyone - but not for bathing here!”
Reviews.Author: flordyigirl2
Reviews.Content: I realize you get what you pay for. $65 per night on the beach with the tiki bar, pool, hot tub, and put put made it sound like something for everyone. Our first room: sit down on the bed and SQUEEEEAK" - HARD AS A ROCK. Flush the toilet - swimming foreign objects. We got upgraded to a suite after maintenance could not fix the commode with a plunger or snake and there was 3" of brown water in the tub! So hurrah! 5th floor - better view - 1 bedroom suite with a jaccuzi. Turn on the water - cold, cold, cold. No dang hot water to bathe! I called the front desk only to hear "I'm sorry" a dozen times because they "had no maintenance man on the weekends". Funny - the snake plumber was still around. So no bath for me all weekend! The rooms were humid and temp never regulated. Maybe I'm just hard to please but I am a boy scout mom having raised four children - I'm pretty tough. Other issues: keys worked off and on, no idea on the breakfast room until the last morning. We survived but I don't plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: espolj
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year staying at the Fountain Beach. Stayed on the 2nd floor in a 1 bedroom unit. We enjoy the admosphere at this resort. The staff are very nice and helpful. The front desk is always helpful and kind. Our unit was cleaned everyday and the cleaning staff were very nice. The 1st floor lobby area is kept clean everyday. The Tiki bar restaurant staff are very nice too and it is clean. We enjoy the pool area. The hot tub was dirty though every day. They have a DJ on the weekends, but we didn't like the music he played. It was not appropriate music if you had children. He did play requests if you asked him. We will be stayng here again next year for the month of February. The unit is within walking distance of restaurants and gift shops. Close to a lot of attractions. Would definitely advise anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One bad thing after another...”
Reviews.Author: alize339
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: great location for spring break, pool area and tiki bar are nice Negatives: My husband and I drove two cars because I was going somewhere else after our trip but the hotel would not let us park two cars- I had to park across the street in the grass where I was worried my car would get towed (but it didn't); the key card to our room would not work- we had it replaced like 3 times; the room itself is definitely nothing fancy, with mismatched furniture (but we didn't really care about that); the bed was hard and the sheets were rough; the smoking rooms are on the same floor as the non-smoking rooms, so pretty much the entire floor smells like smoke; they offer a continental breakfast, which was nice, but the maids sit in the room to keep track of which rooms have eaten so no one eats twice and make sure to remind you to leave them a tip in their little tip envelope (After that I certainly didn't). Finally, my experience with the shower deserves its own paragraph. We didn't have hot water in our room, so I went to call the front desk and our phone didn't work. I went to go downstairs to tell the front desk, but ran into a maid on the way and asked her to do it for me. I guess she said something but never returned to let me know what the deal was. Maintenance never showed up so she offered to let me take a shower in another room that she was cleaning. I should have said no and just taken a cold shower...the water wouldn't get hot in the other room either and once I got in the shower I looked up and saw vomit on the shower curtain! EWWWW! The front desk person was rude about it, didn't even look at me when he was talking to me. All in all, this is a good place to stay if you are a college spring breaker who is just going to be drunk the whole time and want a place to pass out but not good if you are looking for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE HASSLE!!”
Reviews.Author: Corrie143
Reviews.Content: Fountain Beach is far from a resort. What they don't tell you is the majority of their rooms have been sold off as codos and our hallway smelled like burning cheese burgers all weekend. The hot tub and pool were closed by 6 pm and The lobby was plastered with signs for all the things you can rent from them (ironing boards, hair dryers etc.) as well as signs everywhere saying how they would charge you for damages to the room. When we got up to the room the smoke detector was hanging off the ceiling the bathroom door knob was hanging on by a thread and the entire room was rusty, beaten down with 80's throw back furniture. The bed was horribly uncomfortable and I didn't sleep all weekend. Don't trust the pictures they must have fixed up one room in the whole hotel because ours sure didn't look like that. The worst part is they double charged our account and I can't get any of the little kids at the front desk to speak with me intelligently enough to get my money back so i have to go fill out a dispute with my bank!! HORRIBLE HASSLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shellymust
Reviews.Content: The motel is located near alot of bars and restaurants. The price seemed reasonable. But the room was infested with roaches.Next trip to Daytona, we will stay in a nicer motel. You pay for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated great place”
Reviews.Author: ljsflorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 222 it had a view of the water but was not ocean front but it was nicely updated with a flat screen TV and a DVD player and a huge shower head that was great the room was clean with 2 beds and a pull out couch that slept both our kids will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I had anticipated.”
Reviews.Author: jechll
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and updated. All rooms in this hotel have an ocean view. Its right on the water, has a nice pool and jacuzzi and has a tiki bar with karaoke. There is no room service but everyone delivers. The staff was nice and friendly. We will definately come back. It was a great value. Photos coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great job on the remodel, keep it up it's looking great”
Reviews.Author: IronManDrew
Reviews.Content: Cant trust reviews from two years ago, seems like they've done some great renovations. The Tiki bar is the best, great food and staff. Good group of Miami fans in the sports bar made the game a lot of fun (love the 82' flat screen, I want one) Location was perfect east to get every where, close to it all. We had two rooms each was diffeerent. Later found out they are condos and privately owened which my wife loved the personal touches.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!!”
Reviews.Author: haleyscomet389
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in April 2007 and this place sucks. This place smells, the toilet was broken, the medicine cabinet was falling off the wall, our floors were disgusting, the couch stunk so bad, the hot tub was broken, the pool was gross, and the worst part was the bugs everywhere. The staff was mean and unwelcoming. The location was nice very close to cool resturants but we aren't going again and I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price,Friendly Staff, Will come back for a 4th time”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin72Canada
Reviews.Content: Just got back a couple weeks ago from our Daytona Trip in which we stayed at the Fountain Beach Resort. My wife and I have been there twice before last year being our 25th Wedding Anniversary we took another couple and had a great time. This year we took my parents and we went when Biketoberfest was on, we stayed for an entire week. We had a super time and everyone was very friendly. I will start with the Location, you can't beat it, it is right on the Beach and the Beach is to die for. The sand is firm so you can walk easily the water is warm, there are lots of good sized shells if you enjoy going shelling first thing in the morning. The parking is free at the hotel, which all you have to do is park your car and leave it there. Everything is close by, you can walk to the famous Mainstreet which is about a 10 minute walk, also you are walking distance to the Ocean Walk Center if you want to take in a movie at their 10 movie theatre, There are plenty of sovienier shops and restaurants galore. The rooms are very clean,and are all decorated differently as they are all privately owned condo. style. Our room was 513 and we were there last year and it was great and to our suprise when we got there this year it was completly done over again and it was beautiful. My parents were in room 519 and they were very pleased with their room as well.The Oasis Tiki Bar was great , the food was awesome and the drinks were great, the staff were extremely friendly and we were able to take our drinks to the pool and hot tub.(thanks Brandon).The pool was very well maintained and clean, along with the hottub.Great view of beach and ocean from pool side. The view from the southside of the building from our balcony was to die for. beautiful Ocean view and view of pool as well. Management and staff were very friendly and our room maid Gracyie was fabulous. She kept our rooms up to par everyday , always was very friendly and made conversation with us each day in the hall way. One of the days she asked what we were doing that day and we told her we were going to the mall to shop. She suggested for us to go to the Daytona Flea Market instead as it was big and it had everything that the mall had, she even gave us directions. We spent the whole day there and it was a huge shopping experience, Thanks again Gracyie!!! There is a laundry room at the Fountain Beach as well and it came in handy.We had such a great experience at this establishment that we will be returning again next year as it is a Great Place, Great Price, Friendly Staff !!! Thanks again Fountain Beach Resort!!! Your Canadian Friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Studio for a Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: cbreeze2k9
Reviews.Content: We Stayed for a week at the Fountain Beach on the 4th floor (409) and found it to be everything we expected it to be and more. We were actually pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews! Our room was a king with a pull out couch, although it was just my husband and I so we didn't need it, but it was nice to relax on and watch TV. The room had wood & tile floor so no bad carpet which was a plus too, and the bed was comfy which is priority for me because I have some back issues. The staff were generally helpful especially Thomas the night desk clerk and Gerry our room attendant, although the morning desk help didn't seem to like the person who poured the last cup of coffee, whoever you were! The view from our room was just fabulous and we spent lots of time sitting on the balcony enjoying the ocean breeze and even a few sunrises! The Building itself shows its age, and the years of weather, but the maintenance teams are busy Monday through Friday working to keep the place up. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE, HOTWIRE WILL RIP YOU OFF”
Reviews.Author: joshsc83
Reviews.Content: this place is very gross. dont stay here unless you like living in 40 yr old filth. everything was run down and rusty.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrific - Unless you like bugs in your bed and fraternity house odors”
Reviews.Author: Traveler101Tampa
Reviews.Content: Daytona Beach was a half way point for my boyfriend and I to meet up and we thought a nice weekend on the beach at a resort would be ideal (we had never been to Daytona). He booked the Fountain Beach Resort after seeing Orbitz had given it 4 stars (we stayed there 5/01/09 - 5/03/09). We arrived around 10 pm on Friday night and after checking in, we took the elevator to the second floor and as we walked down the hall we were completely disgusted by the smell of what could only be described as a frat house as well as at the sight of stains on the carpet. Opening the door to the room wasn't much better. Everything was completely outdated and the wear and tear on the room was about 3 years overdue for a makeover (the tile floor in the kitchen/bathroom had spots on it and I wore my flip flops at all times because I was afraid to put my bare feet on the floor). We tried to make the best of it saying that we would barely spend any time in the room and would be on the beach most of the time. I barely slept the first night due to the dirty feeling I had about the place and to my horror, the second night confirmed what I felt when when I discovered a small beetle-like bug crawling on boyfriend's pillow followed by another small insect on the inside of his pillow. We killed the bugs thinking that would be the end of them but then we saw a tiny, red, transparent tick like bug that when we killed it, squished blood out into a tissue! We inspected both sides of the pillows and noticed that some of the pillow covers had small, pin drop blood stains on them and it looked like whoever had slept there had probably killed some of these bugs unknowingly with their head (the blood looked old like the pillows had been washed and the blood stains stayed - and I cringed at the thought that my head may have touched it and that the hotel would continue to use those pillows). So, we get new pillows thinking that would be the end of it (we didn't want to deal with this and wanted to be done with it) but keep in mind that my boyfriend had to go to the front desk to get them because when we called down to the person on duty, he wouldn't bring them up to us and sounded completely surprised that we had bugs in the room. He said he never heard of that happening before and that we should bring him the dead bugs so he could see them (we didn't)! He didn't offer us another room either (we didn't think any of the rooms would be any better at this point regardless so we didn't push it). In all honesty, we were trying to make the best of it because it was our last night but when my boyfriend brought up the new pillows and set them on the bed, I see another beetle-like bug 20 minutes later! I look at the wicker headboard and see that they are coming up onto the bed from there! I kill that bug and we actually decided that the other bed (the room had 2 Queen size beds) should be okay to sleep because we hadn't seen any bugs on it (at this point it's late and we're exhausted and his credit card had already been charged for the weekend through Orbitz). I barely slept and kept waking up in the middle of the night to do a bug check and when I did eventually fall asleep (my boyfriend and I slept with our feet to the headboard and our heads at the opposite end just to be safe) and wake up the next morning, I had bug bites all over my arms! I was ready to cry; it was that bad. I travel a lot and have stayed in some places that were not great but this place takes the cake. Truly, this place was disgusting and unless you are in college looking to stay at a cheap place with beach access, I don't see how anyone could enjoy it. This is the first review I've written and I had to comment because the last two reviews from people who stayed there in April could not have more different from the experience I had. One more thing to point out is the beach. The area of the beach where Fountain Beach Resort (the "Resort" title is beyond laughable) resides also happens to be the part of the beach where cars are allowed. So, if you like the smell of exhaust and having your view blocked by cars, Fountain Beach is the place to go. I think I'm going to have to get my blood checked after staying there to ensure that whatever bit me wasn't carrying any diseases. I wish I were joking...

Reviews.Title: “What a great room I had overlooking the ocean, and porch with view of beach!”
Reviews.Author: catlady13
Reviews.Content: I really loved the room I had overlooking the ocean. The room had two large windows, and a side porch with a view of the ocean. There was live music, and a snack resturant downstairs. The room was ultra modern with a VHS and DVD player. Everyone was friendly, and my room was squeeky clean. The only thing I can say is that the kitchen lacked a dishwasher, which didn't bother me, as I was eating out, and enjoying the music on the deck. The whirlpool was very refreshing after a nice swim in the pool. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “602 Lovely VIew and HD TV and jacuzzi Tub”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily46
Reviews.Content: We organized the trip through Sheila Cox and loved the room. It was basically oceanfront and had a lovely king bed and jacuzzi tub. I loved the nice HD TV /DVD player and with Blockbuster nearby it made movie watching easy. I did not like the small shower; but for the price it was much less expensive than oceanwalk and had all the amenities inside the room we stayed. I would definitely stay again. We stayed a couple years back and the front desk were rude. They seem much more accommodating now and the hotel appearance is much more inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: espolj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a privately owned suite and were quite impressed. The rooms were clean and if you had any problems with anything the maintenance people were right on it. After reading the reviews was unsure if we would be satisfied, but they have really upgraded the condo since were stayed here in years past. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. We were so glad the people that worked there spoke English. The security staff were on their toes. Loved the DJ that came on weekends and the TIKI bar was so nice to have. Would stay here again! Pennsylvania Snowbirds

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, clean room, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: honestcan
Reviews.Content: Also stayed in 501, booked through one of the private vacation rental homes sites. My husband and I stayed here in May. Excellent view, very clean, enjoyed people watching and sitting on the patio with the ocean breeze in my face. The pool and grounds were very clean and just steps from the beach. They had live music at the pool area on Sat and Sun which was nice. Had a car rented but also walked to many restaurants and stores. If you like live bands Ocean Deck is just a few steps away in the sand, great place to relax late into the evening and enjoy a few. Everything you need is in the condo, if you want to cook or make your own cooktails all conviences are there. Loved this place, excellant location, close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “"HEALTH HAZARD"”
Reviews.Author: floridajoe01
Reviews.Content: My Husband Daughter and friend came to Daytona Friday night Aug 01, 2008 and stayed at the Fountain Resort. We read the reviews but understand that people can be a little over the top as I had once been in this business so we gave it a shot. You think after being in the business I would have taken the reviews a little more seriously but I did not. Please take it from me DO NOT STAY AT THIS RESORT!!! When we first arrived we went up to our room threw down our belongings and went down to the beach as it was already 10:00 at night. When we arrived back it was one in the morning so we all crashed. My daughter woke up in the middle of the night coughing and saying her throat was scratchy. We then got up and realized what kind of place we were really at. The vent that my daughter was sleeping by was litterly covered in dirt. We went into the bathroom and the ceiling in there was very low. My husband ran his finger along the wall due to the fact we saw mold and the ceiling paint actually crumbled on the floor. The next morning we woke up to take showers my daughter being the first and low and behold no hot water. The shower was so old that when you turned the faucet it felt like the thing was going to brake off. You could not even turn the faucet to the hot side. Needless to say we got out of there quickly as we were to stay 2 nights. Don't bother calling the manager about your issues she will not return your calls (Patty Barker). This place is absolutely horrible. Take my advise and find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Lgri7701
Reviews.Content: We stayed there when they had the poop in the pool incident. It was totally not the hotel's fault and they were on the scene quickly and I was glad to see they closed the pool for awhile, putting their guests saftey first. Our room was clean and it was cleaned each day. We did find two roaches and a bed bug in our room and this is something they really need to deal with. But the pool area was nice and the Tiki bar was clean, the food good and a definite assest to the hotel. The staff was ok, but could be a little friendlier at the front desk. The cleaning ladies could not have been more helpful and nice. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and we would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: bryoung
Reviews.Content: I'm not a very picky person when it comes to hotels but this one was horrible. It is by far the worst place that I have EVER stayed (and I have been to other countries). The room stunk. It smelled like mold. The office staff was rude from the first minute that we walked in. They were rude during the check-in. Our room was not cleaned the entire 3 days that we where there. Also, THERE WAS A SIGN IN THE KITCHEN SAYING THAT IF YOU DO NOT CLEAN UP THE KITCHEN OR LEAVE TRASH YOU WILL BE CHARGED A 50.00 CLEAN UP FEE. What kind of hotel if this? Beware if you are staying there, some of the rooms are sold out to private owners and rented out. I believe that is what we got but wasn't informed of this. Plus, while we were at the pool, we as well as other guest were harassed and told that we had to prove that we were actually staying in the hotel. The pool manager was VERY rude. We had to show our room card or else get kicked out. I can understand that hotels don't want other people using their pool; but the thing that got me was that the guy was SOOOO rude about it. He made us feel like we were criminals. Plus the door to the balcony in the hotel was an old worn-out door. It didn't make me feel safe at all b/c it just had a simple bedroom door lock on it. We paid almost 90.00 a night for this hole in the dump. I would have felt safer in my car. Beware the pictures they show you on the website are nothing like what you see in the rooms. I have pictures of my room if you need to see them.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: missbam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok with the exception that there was hair on the floor. And the room smelled moldy.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Needs a Makeover”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAnne
Reviews.Content: The hotel sign which was a plastic overlay said nightly, extended stay, condo. I agree with previously reviewers that the update in the lobby area is nice. It will take some time and money to get this place up to par. I would like to see the lineolium in the elevators removed and vacuumed regularly. At first it seemed like a lonely place and I was questioning if they gave rooms to the homeless. Then the cheerleaders came in and livened up the place. The bar and grill were opened and had a DJ during the day. I wonder if they were private vendors trying to make a go of it. Our room was OK but didn't like the cleaner smell, prefer good old clorox versus some other smells. Also the hall was noisey and you could see the light coming in from on top of the door. I like clean windows and they should hire or have their staff do them at least once a month. Although it has some private owners they should get the same window treatments especially the ones facing the ocean. It looks bad with all different ones, adds to the tackiness of this place. I felt more comfortable walking on the beach than on the street. Pretty run down in spots. The Pizza Hut smelled terrible too, like a zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: onthemove2363
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was absolutely atrocious and I have the pictures to prove it. If you go to Daytona Beach do not think about staying in this hotel. The window to the outside was jammed and i had to fix it myself. The balcony furniture was all rusty, the air conditioner was rusted, the base molding underneath was all moldy due to an obvious water leak. The furniture looked like it was picked up on the roadside on garbage day, the vent for the stove was absolutely disgusting, it hadn't been cleaned in months, if not years. the sink had not been washed down in who knows how long...there was long dark hair in the sink, it's not mine, i hardly have any! Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NEW revovation, and the Low Price”
Reviews.Author: BobPTampa
Reviews.Content: My Family and I have vacationed in Daytona Beach for years, and have stayed in many of the Hotels there. Over the Years, we have seen more and more of the Family oriented, affordable places disappear to make way for the shiny, over priced Mega-chain places where you are supposed to feel privileged to pay $150.00 Plus a night for a Room on the Beach. I just want a clean room to rent, I'm not looking to go broke, just to stay on the beach for the weekend. The Fountain Beach Resort is not brand new, but the location is Great! The rooms were clean, the public areas have just been renovated, and look Modern, and the service was friendly. We got 2 rooms for the price of one, elsewhere. What else could you want after a day on the Beach. Unless you are looking to spend more just for the sake of wasting money, Stay in an Independently owned place that will appreciate you, and save enough money to eat on while you are there, that's what we have done in the past and will come back and stay again !

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: FromKentucky859
Reviews.Content: Ok, first I would like to say that I am not a picky person. I dont demand glamour and glitz when it comes to hotels. HOWEVER, I found a roach in my room and that is taking in too far. I had just gotten out of the shower on our fourth day there and the roach (about two inches long) crawled across the floor and into my shoe. I woke up my boyfriend and he killed it. I called down to the front desk and explained that I wanted to leave and my money back. The owner refused at first but then only gave back the days that I didnt stay. I was still angry because during the days that we had stayed, roaches could have been crawling in all our things. The owner was horrible and rude (she is an older woman with grayish blonde hair to her shoulders). The owner even had the gumption to say that it wasnt a roach even though we brought it down to show her. That is completely disgusting and in all of the hotels I have stayed in, I have never had a roach, even by the beach. The beds were like seesaws. If you sat on one side the other would fly up. As for the contential breakfast, there wasnt one. If you wanted a bagel or danish you had to pay a dollar! This place is definatly not worth even $10.00 a night. The beach in the area was pretty gross too because of the trash all over the sand and floating in the tide. Please dont stay, unless you want roaches crawling on you and in your things!!!

Reviews.Title: “awsome and layed back loved it”
Reviews.Author: bbqman_7
Reviews.Content: we stayed here july 2006 and we are returning this july 2007. the condo is clean and the staff were very helpful and courteous. never had to worry about your stuff being taken poolside because byron was there to check everybody out good job byron. the food at the tiki bar was excellent especially the grouper sandwich and the nachos. good bands on the weekend and walking distance to everything you want. great price great location. room 205. thanks for everything see you in 1 week.

Reviews.Title: “Understand what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: TitanEddie
Reviews.Content: First off, you have to understand the nature of this place. It is a timeshare/condo type of place. The rooms are completly left up to the owner for upkeep and furnishings so if you have a disappointing room it's not the resorts fault. You can ask the front desk to move you to another room and it may be much better than the one you had. I had room 516 and was very happy, the couple traveling with us had 521 and their room was nice but not as nice as mine. I was told 516 was the best in the place so try to get that room if possible. The good: The rate is reasonable. The resort is in a good location, just south of the pier and close to dining and entertainment and right on the beach. The staff was pretty good for one of these type places. The pool and the putt putt golf were OK. The bad: The outside is in need of some attention. Nothing major but it is starting to look old. The Tiki bar and restaurant are closed and it didn't look like they were planning to reopen. Oceanview means that you have to go out on the balcony to see the ocean. The ugly: Across the street is a market and around the corner from the market is a package store and a bar. This in itself is OK but what it does is attracts homeless people or to be more blunt, drunken bums. Most days there were a couple of them on the property by the beach and the resort did nothing to get rid of them. They did not bother anyone at the resort but off the property they would panhandle. The resort really needs to be agressive in dealing with these people if they want to attract more families. Overall I was not disappointed with this place and would stay again. But I will look for other choices first.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Louisville_KYCindy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 day stay at Fountain Beach Resort and I have to say I did not agree with one of the reviews for suite 501. I pretty much based my choice from what the person said about it and the many pictures they posted made the room seem almost perfect. The view was pretty amazing though. We are not picky people and can tolerate some flaws. But some of these flaws took away from the lovely view. The lights in the master bath over the sink didn't work at all and they finally came to fix them the day before we left. Had to go in the living room area to put on makeup and dry hair. The half bath was so tiny you could barely move and the shower didn't work very well. Got up one morning to find the water shut off. Took half the day to come back on. The air conditioner in the living room area was broken for the first 3 days. The kitchen is so tiny you can barely move and very dirty. The laundry facility had 2 washers & 2 dryers and one of the dryers was out of service off and on. The futons in the living room are filthy on both sides was afraid to sit on them thank goodness they provided two small covers so we put those on the seat to sit on. The lock on the door entering the unit is very poorly installed. And sometimes we couldn't get it to lock at all and that is the only lock on the door. Thank goodness my husband brought some tools along so he was able to tighten it up a bit. But it really needs to be replaced entirely. The whole unit needs a really good cleaning. The walk to the pier was wonderful and it really is a good location. The restaurant is still closed. Would not stay there again unless they completely renovated the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Weekend at the Fountain Beach”
Reviews.Author: Gigantorq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountain Beach for a quick weekend getaway. This hotel is exactly what we needed. We had a King size bed and pull ot sofa for the kids. There was a small kitchenette with a frig, micro and toaster oven. The room was clean, the halls could use a little work. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the pool and the beach. Location is everything. We booked again for the end of July.

Reviews.Title: “Good price...”
Reviews.Author: Madcat007
Reviews.Content: We found the Fountain Beach Resort to be clean and offered two full size beds and a tv/vcr/dvd combo in the large room. The bathroom was extremely small and the unit only offered a small kitchenette. One of my disappointments with the resort is that they do not disclose on their website that the Pub and Tiki-Bar are closed. While that isn't why we chose to stay there, it would've been good to know. The pool was large although food and beverages are not allowed in that area. Also, the elevators are very slow when they're working at all. FBR is located on a fairly busy area of the beach and near a major intersection so this location isn't suggested for someone looking for quiet times. However, for the price we paid for the week, it was worth it. Also, you have easy access to the major highways, the airport and Daytona International Speedway. I will enclose a photo of the view from our unit.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time can't wait to visit again really soon!”
Reviews.Author: Grace1982
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay, and can't wait to go back and visit again. Although it is an older place with some problems here and there, my friend and i found it to be a great place. On our 2nd day there we had a problem with our key not wanting to work the staff was friendly and very quick to respond to our needs. I loved the fact that it was so close to everything in town. I would recomend this place to everyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: amyjo866
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Close enough to the Boardwalk, but no too close. We stayed during Spring Break '07. Many renovations are in progress. The Bar/Restaurant was closed...that was disappointing. Our room had a fabulous view(ocean view suite). The room itself was very spacious...the pullout sofa was not usable though. The staff was helpful and supplied us with a rollaway bed.One of the elevators was malfuctioning ,we did not know this until I got stuck in it. The staff was quick to get me out. We booked through the hotel website and received a military discount ...approx. 10%. We will definately stay here again. Even with the issues the hotel has...we got what we paid for. A decent room for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: nate23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is crap!! Who renovates during spring break? Elevators out of order, water being cut off, the tiki bar was closed. We knew of none of this until we got to the hotel to check in. Don't stay here, its ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great place.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for a nice hotel to stay at for our birthday weekend. When it comes to hotels I’m a cleanliness freak. I read EVERY review on this site about the hotels in the Daytona Beach area. We didn’t have a lot of money so the Hilton or anyplace like that was out of the question. I finally picked the Fountain Beach Resort. My reasons we the two most recent reviews said that is was clean and that they were remodeling the hotel. When we booked the hotel though there website it said that they were remodeling and that you could get rooms as low $39 a night. When we got there you could tell they were remodeling but nothing big to deal with. The lobby was being worked on but the check in was very fast and easy and the lady was nice and friendly . Behind the counter they have about 5 monitors with the view from camera’s that are throughout the hotel. When we got to our room it was better than I thought. Good size, everything was clean, a very comfortable bed and everything looked new. They have a little kitchenette that has plates and cups. The pool was clean and they had a nice jacuzzi. The location was right off International Speedway Drive which made us close to everything. The only thing that was a down side was that we though that we were booking an ocean view and from the description of the rooms on there page we thought you’d be able to look out the window and see the ocean. When we got there you had to go on to the balcony and look towards the ocean. Nothing bad but just not what we thought.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be great when remodling is complete”
Reviews.Author: kpkeyser
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on this for a month, from owner. Then I read some of the reviews and thought what have I gotten myself into. My room was clean and comfortable. Great location and gorgeous view. Hot tub didn't work. Pool is really nice but would be better if heated. for winter months. They are currently upgrading the Tiki Bar. and completely remodling foyer. When work is completed. It will definetly deserve a good rating. Front desk was very courteous and helpful. Nice ocean deck for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Phadergurl
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried when we read some of the bad reviews, but I have to say that we were quite happy with our rooms. They were clean and the location couldn't have been better. We walked down to the boardwalk and pier. There were plenty of restaurants in the area. The area is just what it is. Beachy and layed back. We kept our swim suits on most of the time and walked the beach. The price was right and as I said, the location was ideal. We all had a blast! Alvina

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Clean and spotless room. Fabulous views!”
Reviews.Author: Laurinn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and couldn't have been happier. The room was spotless, well equipped and the views took our breath away. I have to say that we were a bit worried since it is an older building and built in the 70's. Well... once you get past the fact that the buildings older, and you walk into your room, you will feel like you're in paradise. We stayed in room #501. It had a huge bedroom with two queen beds, and a bathroom with a jucuzzi tub. There were two futons in the living room that opened to full size beds, plus another full bathroom off of the living room. Kitchen with a stove, fridge, microwave and fully equipped. There's a restaurant on the property and a tiki bar. The restaurant has the best hamburgers in town. The pool is nice and large and very clean. The hot tub was always nice and clean. I have attached photos of our room. You know how some rooms on the beach can smell musty (that's what we worried about)not the case, this room had a fresh smell and was truly one of the cleanest rooms we've ever stayed. We've paid a lot more money for smaller rooms and views where you had to hang your head off the balcony to see a spec of ocean. We were so impressed with the views of this room. We will be coming back next year and have already booked our stay. The lady that we booked through delt directly with the owner. If you want her name and phone number, email me! Lynn silverslipperz@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: coastieom03
Reviews.Content: Just got home and had to put this review in. if your thinking about staying here go with Stephine Jones and rent condo 205 directly from her.. Its was gorgeous... I was a little afraid after reading all the nasty reviews but when we walked in to our condo I was amazed!!!!!!!! Words can not express the wonderful time my family had at this hotel Our room faced the ocean and we had 2 balconies.. The bedroom had 2 beds, and we had 2 bathrooms one with a Jacuzzi.... There was a kitchen and 2 TV's... This hotel is directly on the beach.. It had a gorgeous pool that was cleaned everyday day... Now for the best part.. McCormick's Pub and Tiki Bar.. Oh my god.. It was awesome.!!! It was right outside the hotel and we had a ball.. We did Kareoke on Friday ,Saturday, and Sunday night and everyday they had something going on there.. We had a Hurricane Party two days in a row..!!!!! Janet and Paul and the rest of the bartending crew were the nicest people ever... And the food was fantastic! We met the nicest people there and will always remember our stay .. WE DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE!!!!! If anyone wants Stephanie Jones # to rent through her.. Just email me and I will give it to you.. Its the way to go!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We rented from the front desk even after reading the reviews on this hotel. I went with some reservations about staying there after some friends left with just me and the kids. I was pleasantly surprised!! The hotel itself was clean, the staff friendly. When we got to our room, we were extremely happy. Our room was clean, neat and the decor was great. The bed extremely comfortable, better than mine at home. The pool was cleaned daily and the pool police were on duty. No one was allowed to bring ANY food or drinks into the pool area. This was a little extreme to us not to allow water or cokes in the pool area but everyone was checked by the pool police to make sure they were supposed to be there and not someone just walking off the beach. Every night the gates were locked at 10 p.m. I understand their rules but a little later would be great for the teenagers we had with us. As for the bar/restaurant beside the pool, everyone there was great, the food was good. We had no problems with anything or anyone there and woiuld definitly recommend it. The entire staff was great during our visit. The hotel was clean and was in great condition. We intend to stay there during our next visit to Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay here if Ever where else in Daytona is on Fire!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the WORSE hotel I have ever stayed in and I'm a big traveler. I stayed there for 5 days and not once did the maids come to clean. To get new towels I had to take my dirty ones downstairs and trade. Staff was very rude. The hotel smells very bad. Don't not stay here uless you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a 'budget vacation'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights the week after Bike Week. The room was decent, service was decent. We paid $89.00 a night for a room in an ocean front hotel. Where else are you going to find a place like that for that kind of rate? It was a nice place for the money. We got exactly what we expected...A decent hotel room and service for $89.00 a night. I would definately stay there again. Room was clean, towels changed daily.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not that hard to please and only expect a clean room. Our room was filthy as if not vaccumed for years. There were beer bottle caps and other items under the bed. Dishes had brown stuff stuck to them. There were no dish towels, shampoo, hair dryer. etc. as one would expect for the price. The ocean view was misleading and the free passes to Daytona USA were not as promised. Also, we had a coffee pot but no coffee and two towels for three people. When we asked for extra towels were told sorry we are really busy this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Fountain for the last night of Bikeweek 2006. I made my reservationby phone so I could talk to a real person. I needed a room close to main street so we could park the bikes, walk to the bars and not worry about drinking and riding back to the hotel. When I made the reservation I give them my credit card number to hold the room (as with any other hotel) and my name, address and phone number. The day of our stay we waited until check in time (~3:00pm) to visit the hotel. Since we had our bags attached to the bag we wanted to check in as soon as possiable so we wouldn't have to worry about them. When I got to the lobby to check in I was informed that the room we booked belong to a 'time share' and that the owner decided he wasn't going to rent out the room after all and was staying an extra night. ???? They made no attempt to contact us at all. Finding a room close to main street durning bike week is next to impossiable on the same day without having to pay a huge sum of money! (The room was $200 for just one night in an old hotel already) The manager on duty (Michael Smith) said he got us a room at the Travelodge for the same price, but it was a mile from main street, and didn't have the same resport facilities (bar, etc.) Not worth the money for a Travelodge. I don't know how a hotel can make a contract with you for a stay and then break it last minute but they did. Mr. Smith also said that ALL the staff was new and had only been working for the past week or two.

Reviews.Title: “extremely dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a room at the fountain beach hotel for four nights during the 24 hours of Daytona race. Upon checking in I found the lobby to be ill kept very tired. The next surprise was the room charge of $150.00 plus a $50.00 "damage deposit". I had expected the room to be $100.00. Upon entering the room I was stunned by the deplorable conditiion. Furnishings were broken, the carpet was filthy with thash and dirt under the beds. The window was so dirty I literly could not see through it. Needless to say, I could not wait for the next morning to arrive so that I could leave that place. I then found a room at the Holiday Inn Express near the track for $102.00 and felt like I was in a Four Seasons after the bazar experience the fountain beach. I would literally sleep in my car before I would stay there again. Hopefully they will remodel that frightful place.

Reviews.Title: “Now that the remodel is nearly finished, the place is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was booked at the Fountain Beach and was dreading it after I read all the reviews. But when we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly and the room was lovely. It looked like it had just been remodeled. Tile throughout, tiffany lamps, beach scenes and even holiday decor. Very pleasant. The staff did say they had been through a lot with the remodeling of the common areas and many rooms had also undergone extensive makeovers. So... not so bad. Just be sure to ask for one of the remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the fountain beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are not complainers so after you read this story you will see we are "benefit of the doubt" type people. Ok, here we go, my wife and I had confirmed reservations for an ocean view studio with jacuzzi. After all the paperwork is filled out the attendant tells us that: "Oh, we didn't have the room you wanted but we put you one room down from a beach front". We go look at it and there is a guy painting the doors for the rooms and asks if we are staying on this floor. We say yes and he then informs us we can't close the doors for 24 hrs. but there will be a person patroling the floor. We understand that upgrades need to be made, I was in the flooring business and hotels are what we did mostly. Not wanting to have our room door open while we slept we go down to get another room. He then tells us that he does have a beach front room without jacuzzi so we say fine and he is going to take 20 bucks off the price per night. We go up to look at it and the room isn't even made up. There is a bed frame on the floor but the mattress and box spring are leaning up against the wall and the blinds are laying on the floor, the carpet is gross, paint buckets are in there and the palce is just a mess. We go back down and give them one last chance and he gives me a key for the next room (which he said he didn't have any left but miraculously finds one) and the key does not work. I then have to go back downstairs and he then gives me the master key to all the rooms in the hotel. Good thing I am an honest person or I could have robbed the place blind. So we go up and look at it and it is just ok. We go back down and say it is ok and ask him what he is going to do for us and he gives me a snotty remark of "I told you I was going to knock 20 bucks off a night". I said not good enough and I would not have paid 20 bucks a night to stay in that place. I have slept under a bridge on my way down to virginia beach when I rode my motorcycle that was better than that place. Word of advice, DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!!!!!!! WE DIDN"T!

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: auditoriii
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Daytona Beach and my stay at the Fountain Beach. I am a traveler who only needs a safe and clean place to stay - nothing fancy, but near (within walking distance) to all of the attractions. That's why I chose Fountain Beach. First, let me state that the staff was EXTREMELY friendly to me as soon as we arrived. We had only one incident where, after our room was cleaned, the door was not fully shut. This was due to the hallway being recent painted and not completely finished/dry. Therefore, upon entering and exiting, the door needs to be "slammed" closed. Nothing was missing or out of place, nor did I believe this was on purpose or negligent, and the staff was apologetic. That being said, the hotel itself is OLD and in need of upgrades - new carpets, window treatments, some furniture, etc. However, the pool, hot tub, air conditioner, refridgerator, microwave were all in fine, working condition. The hallways were damp, but I blame that on hurricane Ophelia... If you are expecting a Holiday Inn, Hilton type of place, the Fountain is not for you. If you want a clean, safe, cheap, rustic hotel near the pier, then, by all means, try out the Fountain. p.s. Ocean Walk is mostly, if not all TIME SHARE units. We went there after reading all of the positiveposts here and were constantly accosted by salespeople trying to get us to a "presentation"....

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we got to the Fountain, which was early, the people inside was very rude to us. they said that there was no rooms available and that check in was at 3. understandable. We said that we had been driving all night and that we had a 2 year old and asked if there were any rooms that would be cleaned any time soon and the lady said no check in is at 3 we won't have a room until then. We asked again , she didn't look up and said no we don't and won't have any rooms until 3 you will have to come back. This was 7 in the morning. We talked to a couple that was leaving and they said that there was alot of rooms that were empty and that they were not staying another night. We ended up going to another hotel. They treated us great, got us right in and we stayed extra days. The rooms could have been nice, but the service was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “You Don't Always Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: BrendaS
Reviews.Content: The literature for this 'resort' promised a clean and well-tended property. The front desk and lobby live up to that, but the room did not. We have stayed at many hotels in Daytona Beach and are not difficult to please. Just give us a view and a reasonably clean and safe environment to enjoy it from. The stairwells were not usable due to the horrendous stench. One of the two elevators was broken for most of our seven day stay. The carpet in the room was filthy with what appeared to be a large piece of gum stuck right in the middle. The door to the balcony was broken and would not lock. The toilet handle had to be jiggled with every flush to stop it from running. The bathroom was so tiny it felt like being in a public restroom stall. We had maid service the first morning and then after 2 days of no service we complained at 1p.m. and were told that housekeeping had left for the day. The next day we left our room at 9:05a.m. and noted that the maid's cart was in the hallway and expected service. We did not get it, again. I called the front desk and was transferred to the housekeeping supervisor who informed me that she would have it attended to. A short time later I received a call from the maid saying she would be glad to clean my room if I would remove the 'do not disturb' sign from my door. I informed her that I had removed the sign from the door at 9:05a.m. and that I did not think that to be an unreasonable time to request service. I then called the manager of the hotel and expressed my displeasure at being chastised by the maid and he said someone would be in my room in 5 minutes. The housekeeping supervisor and another person arrived and the supervisor told me that the maid assigned to my room would not clean it because I left the sign on the door. I repeated to her that I had removed the sign at 9:05a.m. and that I was on vacation and did not expect to have to arise at the crack of dawn in order to get clean sheets and towels. She shrugged. The floor was not vacuumed for the entire stay. No follow-up from management, and no apologies. The location is fantastic. The pool was okay but cold. We love Daytona and will definitely be back and might even use this hotel if in a bind, but certainly not our first choice, and whatever happened to common courtesy and customer service. We try to treat all people with respect and wish for the same in return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Daytona and had to write ASAP! We had a terrific time. And we absolutely LOVED your condo. It was decorated so nicely and was so comfy, it felt like home. You do a wonderful job renting your unit. We will certainly keep that in mind and will spread the word to friends. Thanks so much! Take care!

Reviews.Title: “great place to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a unit.My first day there was great,the pool, tiki bar facing the ocean.the rental program is great for my investment. I use it when i want to or rent it With all the activities going on didnt have much time to rest Im looking forward to my next visit. gloriachrs@earthlink.net

HotelInfo.Name: Fountain Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 313 S Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
